original: 1. Kosambakavivādakathā

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā kosambiyaṁ viharati ghositārāme.

original: So tassā āpattiyā āpattidiṭṭhi hoti;
analyzed: so tassāḥ āpattiyāḥ āpatti diṭṭhi hoti

analyzed: aññe bhikkhū tassā āpattiyāḥ anāpatti diṭṭhinaḥ honti

original: So aparena samayena tassā āpattiyā anāpattidiṭṭhi hoti;
analyzed: so aparena samayena tassā āpattiyāḥ anāpatti diṭṭhi hoti

original: aññe bhikkhū tassā āpattiyā āpattidiṭṭhino honti.
analyzed: aññe bhikkhū tassā āpattiyā āpatti diṭṭhinaḥ honti
translated: while the other monks regarded it as an offense.

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū taṁ bhikkhuṁ etadavocuṁ—
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū tam bhikkhum etat avocuḥ

original: “āpattiṁ tvaṁ, āvuso, āpanno, passasetaṁ āpattin”ti?
analyzed: āpattim tvaṃ āvuso āpanno passase etam āpattinti
translated: “You’ve committed an offense. Do you recognize it?”

original: “Natthi me, āvuso, āpatti yamahaṁ passeyyan”ti.
analyzed: natthi me āvuso āpatti yam aham passeyyanti
translated: “I haven’t committed any offense that I should recognize.”

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū sāmaggiṁ labhitvā taṁ bhikkhuṁ āpattiyā adassane ukkhipiṁsu.
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū sāmaggim labhitvā tam bhikkhum āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhipisu
translated: After getting consent, those monks ejected him for not recognizing an offense.

original: So ca bhikkhu bahussuto hoti āgatāgamo dhammadharo vinayadharo mātikādharo paṇḍito byatto medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhākāmo.
analyzed: so ca bhikkhu bahu ssutaḥ hoti āgata āgamaḥ dhamma dharaḥ vinaya dharaḥ mātikā dharaḥ paṇḍitaḥ byattaḥ medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhā kāmo
translated: And that monk was learned and a master of the tradition; he was an expert on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Key Terms; he was knowledgeable and competent, had a sense of conscience, and was afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.

original: Atha kho so bhikkhu sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho saḥ bhikkhu sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā etat avoca

original: “anāpatti esā, āvuso, nesā āpatti.🔽Anāpannomhi, namhi āpanno.
analyzed: anāpatti esā āvuso na isā āpatti  an āpannaḥ namhi āpannaḥ
translated: “This isn’t an offense.🔽I haven’t committed an offense.

original: Anukkhittomhi, namhi ukkhitto.
analyzed: an ukkhittomhi na mhi ukkhitto
translated: I haven’t been ejected.

original: Adhammikenamhi kammena ukkhitto kuppena aṭṭhānārahena.
analyzed: adhammikena mhi kammena ukkhitto kuppena a ṭṭhāna arahena
translated: I’ve been ejected illegitimately, by a factional, incomplete Sangha.

original: Hotha me āyasmanto dhammato vinayato pakkhā”ti.
analyzed: hotha me āyasmantaḥ dhammataḥ vinayataḥ pakkhāti
translated: Please support me.”

original: Alabhi kho so bhikkhu sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhū pakkhe.
analyzed: alabhi kho so bhikkhu sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhū pakkhe
translated: He got the support of the monks who had seen and heard him.

original: Jānapadānampi sandiṭṭhānaṁ sambhattānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ santike dūtaṁ pāhesi—
analyzed: jānapadānam pi sandiṭṭhānam sambhattānam bhikkhūnam santike dūtam pāhesi
translated: He then sent a message to other monks who were his friends and acquaintances in the region,

original: “anāpatti esā, āvuso, nesā āpatti.🔽Anāpannomhi, namhi āpanno.
analyzed: anāpatti esā āvuso na isā āpatti  an āpannaḥ namhi āpannaḥ
translated: “This isn’t an offense.🔽I haven’t committed an offense.

original: Anukkhittomhi, namhi ukkhitto.

original: Hontu me āyasmanto dhammato vinayato pakkhā”ti.

translated: Please side with me on the basis of the Teaching and the Monastic Law.”

original: Alabhi kho so bhikkhu jānapadepi sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhū pakkhe.
analyzed: alabhi kho so bhikkhu jānapade pi sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhū pakkhe
translated: He then got supporters for himself among the monks who lived in the same region.

translated: He regards it as an offense, but the other monks regard it as no offense.

original: saṅghanānākaraṇan’ti, bhedagarukehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi na so bhikkhu āpattiyā
analyzed: saṅgha nānākaraṇanti bheda garukehi bhikkhave bhikkhūhi na saḥ bhikkhu āpattiyā
translated: ‘A schism in the Sangha,’ then, monks who are concerned about schisms in the Sangha should not press him on that matter.

original: adassane ukkhipitabbo.
analyzed: a dassane ukkhipitabbaḥ
translated: ‘The schism in the Sangha,’ then that monk should not be suspended for not recognizing an offense🔽by monks who are concerned about schisms in the Sangha.

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu āpattiṁ āpanno hoti.
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu āpattim āpannaḥ hoti
translated: It may be that a monk has committed an offense.

original: So tassā āpattiyā anāpattidiṭṭhi hoti, aññe bhikkhū tassā āpattiyā āpattidiṭṭhino honti.
analyzed: so tassā āpattiyā anāpatti diṭṭhi hoti aññe bhikkhū tassā āpattiyā āpatti diṭṭhino honti
translated: He regards it as not being an offense, while the other monks regard it as an offense.🔽If the monks know about that monk—

original: Te ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhū taṁ bhikkhuṁ evaṁ jānanti—‘ayaṁ kho āyasmā bahussuto āgatāgamo dhammadharo vinayadharo mātikādharo paṇḍito byatto medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhākāmo.
analyzed: te ce bhikkhave bhikkhū tam bhikkhum evam jānanti ayam kho āyasmā bahussutaḥ āgata āgamaḥ dhamma dharaḥ vinaya dharaḥ mātikā dharaḥ paṇḍitaḥ byattaḥ medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhā kāmo
translated: ‘This venerable is learned and a master of the tradition; he’s an expert on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Key Terms; he’s knowledgeable and competent, has a sense of conscience, and is afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.🔽If we suspend him for not recognizing an offense, we won’t do the observance-day ceremony with him.

original: Sace mayaṁ imaṁ bhikkhuṁ āpattiyā adassane ukkhipissāma, na mayaṁ iminā bhikkhunā saddhiṁ pavāressāma, vinā iminā bhikkhunā pavāressāma.
analyzed: sace mayam imam bhikkhum āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhipissāma na mayam iminā bhikkhunā saddhim pavāressāma vinā iminā bhikkhunā pavāressāma
translated: We’ll do it without him.🔽We won’t do a legal procedure with him.

original: Na mayaṁ iminā bhikkhunā saddhiṁ saṅghakammaṁ karissāma, vinā iminā bhikkhunā saṅghakammaṁ karissāma.
analyzed: na mayam iminā bhikkhunā saddhim saṅgha kammam karissāma vinā iminā bhikkhunā saṅgha kammam karissāma
translated: We’ll do it without him.’

original: Na mayaṁ iminā bhikkhunā saddhiṁ āsane nisīdissāma, vinā iminā bhikkhunā āsane nisīdissāma.🔽Na mayaṁ iminā bhikkhunā saddhiṁ yāgupāne nisīdissāma, vinā iminā bhikkhunā yāgupāne nisīdissāma.
analyzed: na mayam iminā bhikkhunā saddhim āsane nisīdissāma vinā iminā bhikkhunā āsane nisīdissāma  na mayam iminā bhikkhunā saddhim yāgu pāne nisīdissāma vinā iminā bhikkhunā yāgu pāne nisīdissāma
translated: ‘We won’t sit on a seat with this monk. We’ll sit on a seat without him.🔽‘We won’t sit in the serving area with this monk. We’ll sit in the serving area without him.

original: Na mayaṁ iminā bhikkhunā saddhiṁ bhattagge nisīdissāma, vinā iminā bhikkhunā bhattagge nisīdissāma.
analyzed: na mayam iminā bhikkhunā saddhim bhattagge nisīdissāma vinā iminā bhikkhunā bhattagge nisīdissāma
translated: ‘We won’t sit in the dining hall with this monk. We’ll sit in the dining hall without him.

original: Na mayaṁ iminā bhikkhunā saddhiṁ ekacchanne vasissāma, vinā iminā bhikkhunā ekacchanne vasissāma.🔽Na mayaṁ iminā bhikkhunā saddhiṁ yathāvuḍḍhaṁ abhivādanaṁ paccuṭṭhānaṁ añjalikammaṁ🔽sāmīcikammaṁ karissāma, vinā iminā bhikkhunā yathāvuḍḍhaṁ abhivādanaṁ paccuṭṭhānaṁ
analyzed: na mayam iminā bhikkhunā saddhim ekacchanne vasissāma vinā iminā bhikkhunā ekacchanne vasissāma  na mayam iminā bhikkhunā saddhim yathāvuḍḍham abhivādanam paccuṭṭhānam añjali kamma  sāmīci kammam karissāma vinā iminā bhikkhunā yathāvuḍḍham abhivādanam paccuṭṭhāna
translated: ‘We won’t stay in the same room with this monk. We’ll stay in a different room from him.🔽‘We won’t do the greetings of respect with this monk according to seniority. We’ll do the greetings of respect with him according to age.

original: añjalikammaṁ sāmīcikammaṁ karissāma.
analyzed: añjali kammam sāmīci kammam karissāma
translated: ‘We won’t do acts of friendliness with this monk according to seniority. We’ll do acts of friendliness with him according to age.

original: Bhavissati saṅghassa tatonidānaṁ bhaṇḍanaṁ kalaho viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji
analyzed: bhavissati saṅghassa tatonidānam bhaṇḍanam kalahaḥ viggahaḥ vivādaḥ saṅgha bhedaḥ saṅgha rāji
translated: ‘There will be quarrels, arguments, and disputes in the Sangha, and a split in the Sangha, because of this monk.’

original: saṅghavavatthānaṁ saṅghanānākaraṇan’ti, bhedagarukehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi na so
analyzed: saṅgha vavatthānam saṅgha nānākaraṇan ti bheda garukehi bhikkhave bhikkhūhi na so
translated: The schism is the division in the Sangha.’

original: bhikkhu āpattiyā adassane ukkhipitabbo”ti.🔽Atha kho bhagavā ukkhepakānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ etamatthaṁ bhāsitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā yena ukkhittānuvattakā
analyzed: bhikkhu āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhipitabbaḥ ti  atha kho bhagavā ukkhepakānam bhikkhūnam etam attham bhāsitvā uṭṭhāya āsanā yena ukkhitta anuvattakā
translated: Monks who respect the schism shouldn’t eject that monk for not recognizing an offense.”

original: bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi, nisajja kho bhagavā ukkhittānuvattake bhikkhū etadavoca—
analyzed: bhikkhū tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi nisajja kho bhagavā ukkhitta anuvattake bhikkhū etat avoca
translated: After speaking thus, the Buddha got up from his seat and went to the monks who were siding with the ejected monk. He sat down on the prepared seat and said to them:

original: “mā kho tumhe, bhikkhave, āpattiṁ āpajjitvā ‘nāmha āpannā, nāmha āpannā’ti āpattiṁ na paṭikātabbaṁ maññittha.
analyzed: mā kho tumhe bhikkhave āpattim āpajjitvā na āmhe āpannā na āmhe āpannā ati āpattim na paṭikātabbam maññittha
translated: “When you’ve committed an offense, don’t think, ‘We haven’t committed an offense. We haven’t committed an offense.’

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu āpattiṁ āpanno hoti.
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu āpattim āpannaḥ hoti
translated: It may be that a monk has committed an offense.

original: So tassā āpattiyā anāpattidiṭṭhi hoti, aññe bhikkhū tassā āpattiyā āpattidiṭṭhino honti.
analyzed: so tassā āpattiyā anāpatti diṭṭhi hoti aññe bhikkhū tassā āpattiyā āpatti diṭṭhino honti
translated: He regards it as not being an offense, while the other monks regard it as an offense.

original: So ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu te bhikkhū evaṁ jānāti—‘ime kho āyasmanto bahussutā āgatāgamā
analyzed: saḥ ce bhikkhave bhikkhu te bhikkhū evam jānāti ime kho āyasmantaḥ bahu ssutāḥ āgata āgamāḥ
translated: If that monk knows of those monks that they’re learned and bearers of the tradition,

original: dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā paṇḍitā byattā medhāvino lajjino kukkuccakā sikkhākāmā,
analyzed: dhamma dharāḥ vinaya dharāḥ mātikā dharāḥ paṇḍitāḥ byattāḥ medhāvinaḥ lajjinaḥ kukkuccakā sikkhā kāmā
translated: who are knowledgeable and competent, who have a sense of conscience, who are afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.

original: nālaṁ mamaṁ vā kāraṇā aññesaṁ vā kāraṇā chandā dosā mohā bhayā agatiṁ gantuṁ.
analyzed: na alam mamam vā kāraṇā aññesam vā kāraṇā chandā dosā mohā bhayā agatim gantu
translated: I’m not likely to go to a bad rebirth because of my own wishes or because of the wishes of others, or because of desire, ill will, confusion, or fear.

original: Sace maṁ ime bhikkhū āpattiyā adassane ukkhipissanti, na mayā saddhiṁ uposathaṁ karissanti,🔽vinā mayā uposathaṁ karissanti, bhavissati saṅghassa tatonidānaṁ bhaṇḍanaṁ kalaho
analyzed: sace mam ime bhikkhū āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhipissanti na mayā saddhim uposatham karissanti  vinā mayā uposatham karissanti bhavissati saṅghassa tatonidānam bhaṇḍanam kalahaḥ
translated: If they eject me for not recognizing an offense, they won’t do the observance-day ceremony with me.🔽They’ll do the observance-day ceremony without me. And that will be a cause of quarreling, arguing, conflict, and strife,

original: viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji saṅghavavatthānaṁ saṅghanānākaraṇan’ti, bhedagarukena,
analyzed: viggahaḥ vivādaḥ saṅgha bhedaḥ saṅgha rāji saṅgha vavatthānam saṅgha nānā karaṇan ti bheda garukena
translated: a fracture and schism in the Sangha, the monks will be divided.’🔽A monk who values unity

original: bhikkhave, bhikkhunā paresampi saddhāya āpatti desetabbā.
analyzed: bhikkhave bhikkhunā paresam pi saddhāya āpatti desetabbā
translated: should confess an offense even on the say-so of others.

original: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu āpattiṁ āpanno hoti.
analyzed: idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu āpattim āpannaḥ hoti
translated: It may be that a monk has committed an offense.

original: So tassā āpattiyā anāpattidiṭṭhi hoti, aññe bhikkhū tassā āpattiyā āpattidiṭṭhino honti.
analyzed: so tassā āpattiyā anāpatti diṭṭhi hoti aññe bhikkhū tassā āpattiyā āpatti diṭṭhino honti
translated: He regards that offense as not being an offense, while the other monks regard it as an offense.

original: So ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu te bhikkhū evaṁ jānāti—‘ime kho āyasmanto bahussutā āgatāgamā
analyzed: saḥ ce bhikkhave bhikkhu te bhikkhū evam jānāti ime kho āyasmantaḥ bahu ssutāḥ āgata āgamāḥ
translated: If that monk knows that those monks are learned, bearers of the Teaching,

original: dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā paṇḍitā byattā medhāvino lajjino kukkuccakā sikkhākāmā,
analyzed: dhamma dharāḥ vinaya dharāḥ mātikā dharāḥ paṇḍitāḥ byattāḥ medhāvinaḥ lajjinaḥ kukkuccakā sikkhā kāmā
translated: bearers of the Monastic Law, bearers of the analysis of the Monastic Law, and if he knows that they’re wise, competent, and conscientious, and that they’re keen to train,

original: nālaṁ mamaṁ vā kāraṇā aññesaṁ vā kāraṇā chandā dosā mohā bhayā agatiṁ gantuṁ.
analyzed: na alam mamam vā kāraṇā aññesam vā kāraṇā chandā dosā mohā bhayā agatim gantu
translated: then he shouldn’t go along with them out of desire, ill will, confusion, or fear.

original: Sace maṁ ime bhikkhū āpattiyā adassane ukkhipissanti, na mayā saddhiṁ pavāressanti, vinā mayā pavāressanti.
analyzed: sace mam ime bhikkhū āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhipissanti na mayā saddhim pavāressanti vinā mayā pavāressanti
translated: If they eject me for not recognizing an offense, they won’t do the invitation ceremony with me. They’ll do the invitation ceremony without me.

original: Na mayā saddhiṁ saṅghakammaṁ karissanti, vinā mayā saṅghakammaṁ karissanti.🔽Na mayā saddhiṁ āsane nisīdissanti, vinā mayā āsane nisīdissanti.🔽Na mayā saddhiṁ yāgupāne nisīdissanti, vinā mayā yāgupāne nisīdissanti.
analyzed: na mayā saddhim saṅgha kammam karissanti vinā mayā saṅgha kammam karissanti  na mayā saddhim āsane nisīdissanti vinā mayā āsane nisīdissanti  na mayā saddhim yāgu pāne nisīdissanti vinā mayā yāgu pāne nisīdissanti
translated: They won’t do a legal procedure with me. They’ll do a legal procedure without me.🔽They won’t sit on the same seat as me. They’ll sit on a different seat than me.🔽They won’t sit with me in the drinking hall. They’ll sit without me in the drinking hall.

original: Na mayā saddhiṁ bhattagge nisīdissanti vinā mayā bhattagge nisīdissanti.
analyzed: na mayā saddhim bhattagge nisīdissanti vinā mayā bhattagge nisīdissanti
translated: They won’t sit with me in the dining hall. They’ll sit without me in the dining hall.

original: Na mayā saddhiṁ ekacchanne vasissanti, vinā mayā ekacchanne vasissanti.
analyzed: na mayā saddhim ekacchanne vasissanti vinā mayā ekacchanne vasissanti
translated: They won’t live in the same place as me, but they will live in the same place without me.

original: Na mayā saddhiṁ yathāvuḍḍhaṁ abhivādanaṁ paccuṭṭhānaṁ añjalikammaṁ sāmīcikammaṁ karissanti,🔽vinā mayā yathāvuḍḍhaṁ abhivādanaṁ paccuṭṭhānaṁ añjalikammaṁ sāmīcikammaṁ karissanti,
analyzed: na mayā saddhim yathāvuḍḍham abhivādanam paccuṭṭhānam añjali kammam sāmīci kammam karissanti  vinā mayā yathāvuḍḍham abhivādanam paccuṭṭhānam añjali kammam sāmīci kammam karissanti
translated: They won’t do the duties in the proper order with me, but they will do the duties in the proper order without me.

original: bhavissati saṅghassa tatonidānaṁ bhaṇḍanaṁ kalaho viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji🔽saṅghavavatthānaṁ saṅghanānākaraṇan’ti, bhedagarukena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā paresampi
analyzed: bhavissati saṅghassa tatonidānam bhaṇḍanam kalahaḥ viggahaḥ vivādaḥ saṅgha bhedaḥ saṅgha rāji  saṅgha vavatthānam saṅgha nānākaraṇan ti bheda garukena bhikkhave bhikkhunā paresam pi
translated: They will cause a legal issue in the Sangha, a dispute in the Sangha, a schism in the Sangha, a fracture in the Sangha, a falling out in the Sangha, a difference in the Sangha, a variance in the Sangha, a division in the Sangha.’

original: saddhāya āpatti desetabbā”ti.
analyzed: saddhāya āpatti desetabbā ati
translated: A monk who respects the schism should confess an offense even on the basis of another’s trust.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā ukkhittānuvattakānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ etamatthaṁ bhāsitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā ukkhitta anuvattakānam bhikkhūnam etam attham bhāsitvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi
translated: After speaking thus, the Buddha got up from his seat and left.

original: Tena kho pana samayena ukkhittānuvattakā bhikkhū tattheva antosīmāya uposathaṁ karonti, saṅghakammaṁ karonti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena ukkhitta anuvattakāḥ bhikkhū tattha iva antosīmāya uposatham karonti saṅgha kammam karonti
translated: Soon afterwards the monks who sided with the ejected monks did the observance-day ceremony and the legal procedures of the Sangha right there within the same monastery zone.

original: Ukkhepakā pana bhikkhū nissīmaṁ gantvā uposathaṁ karonti, saṅghakammaṁ karonti.
analyzed: ukkhepakāḥ pana bhikkhū nissīmam gantvā uposatham karonti saṅgha kammam karonti
translated: But the monks who had done the suspension went outside the monastery zone and did the observance-day ceremony and the legal procedures of the Sangha there.

original: Atha kho aññataro ukkhepako bhikkhu yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.🔽Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho aññataraḥ ukkhepakaḥ bhikkhu yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi  ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho saḥ bhikkhu bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then one of the monks who had done the suspension went to the Buddha, bowed,

original: “Te, bhante, ukkhittānuvattakā bhikkhū tattheva antosīmāya uposathaṁ karonti, saṅghakammaṁ karonti.
analyzed: te bhante ukkhitta anuvattakāḥ bhikkhū tattha iva antosīmāya uposatham karonti saṅgha kammam karonti
translated: and said, “Venerable Sir, the monks who are following the monk suspended by the Sangha are doing the observance-day ceremony and the legal procedures of the Sangha right there within the monastery zone.

original: Mayaṁ pana ukkhepakā bhikkhū nissīmaṁ gantvā uposathaṁ karoma, saṅghakammaṁ karomā”ti.
analyzed: mayam pana ukkhepakāḥ bhikkhū nissīmam gantvā uposatham karoma saṅgha kammam karoma ati
translated: But we, the monks who have done the suspension, are doing the observance-day ceremony and the legal procedures of the Sangha outside the monastery zone.”

original: “Te ce, bhikkhu, ukkhittānuvattakā bhikkhū tattheva antosīmāya uposathaṁ karissanti,🔽saṅghakammaṁ karissanti, yathā mayā ñatti ca anussāvanā ca paññattā, tesaṁ tāni kammāni
analyzed: te ce bhikkhu ukkhitta anuvattakāḥ bhikkhū tattha eva antosīmāya uposatham karissanti  saṅgha kammam karissanti yathā mayā ñatti ca anussāvanā ca paññattā tesam tāni kammāni
translated: “If the monks who are following the monk suspended by the Sangha do the observance-day ceremony and the legal procedures of the Sangha right there within the monastery zone,

original: dhammikāni kammāni bhavissanti akuppāni ṭhānārahāni.
analyzed: dhammikāni kammāni bhavissanti akuppāni ṭhāna arahāni
translated: then those legal procedures are legitimate, irreversible, and fit to stand.

original: Tumhe ce, bhikkhu, ukkhepakā bhikkhū tattheva antosīmāya uposathaṁ karissatha, saṅghakammaṁ
analyzed: tumhe ce bhikkhu ukkhepakāḥ bhikkhū tattha iva antosīmāya uposatham karissatha saṅgha kamma
translated: If you, monks, do the observance-day ceremony and the legal procedures of a complete assembly right there within the same monastery zone, then the resident monks are at fault and the resident nuns are at fault.🔽

original: karissatha, yathā mayā ñatti ca anussāvanā ca paññattā, tumhākampi tāni kammāni dhammikāni
analyzed: karissatha yathā mayā ñatti ca anussāvanā ca paññattā tumhākam pi tāni kammāni dhammikāni
translated: If you, monk, were to do the observance-day ceremony and do a legal procedure of the Sangha right there within the monastery zone, in accordance with the motion and announcement that I have declared, then those legal procedures of yours would be legitimate,

original: kammāni bhavissanti akuppāni ṭhānārahāni.
analyzed: kammāni bhavissanti akuppāni ṭhāna arahāni
translated: reversible with cause, and fit to stand.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Nānāsaṁvāsakā ete bhikkhū tumhehi, tumhe ca tehi nānāsaṁvāsakā.
analyzed: nānā savāsakāḥ ete bhikkhū tumhehi tumhe ca tehi nānā savāsakā
translated: Those monks who have ejected you are of the same affiliation as you, and you are of the same affiliation as them.

original: Dvemā, bhikkhu, nānāsaṁvāsakabhūmiyo—
analyzed: dve imāḥ bhikkhu nānā savāsaka bhūmiyaḥ
translated: There are two grounds for being of a different affiliation:

original: attanā vā attānaṁ nānāsaṁvāsakaṁ karoti, samaggo vā naṁ saṅgho ukkhipati adassane vā appaṭikamme vā appaṭinissagge vā.🔽Imā kho, bhikkhu, dve nānāsaṁvāsakabhūmiyo.
analyzed: attanā vā attānam nānā savāsakam karoti samaggaḥ vā nam saṅghaḥ ukkhipati a dassane vā appaṭikamme vā appaṭinissagge vā  imāḥ kho bhikkhu dve nānā savāsaka bhūmiyaḥ
translated: one makes oneself of a different affiliation, or the Sangha ejects one for not recognizing an offense, for not making amends for an offense, or for not giving up a bad view.🔽These are the two grounds for being of a different affiliation.

original: Dvemā, bhikkhu, samānasaṁvāsakabhūmiyo—
analyzed: dve imāḥ bhikkhu samāna savāsaka bhūmiyaḥ
translated: There are two grounds for being of the same affiliation:

original: attanā vā attānaṁ samānasaṁvāsaṁ karoti, samaggo vā naṁ saṅgho ukkhittaṁ osāreti adassane vā appaṭikamme vā appaṭinissagge vā.
analyzed: attanā vā attānam samāna savāsam karoti samaggaḥ vā nam saṅghaḥ ukkhittam osāreti a dassane vā appaṭikamme vā appaṭinissagge vā
translated: one makes oneself of the same affiliation, or the Sangha, having ejected one, rehabilitates him for not recognizing an offense, for not making amends for an offense, or for not giving up a bad view.

original: Imā kho, bhikkhu, dve samānasaṁvāsakabhūmiyo”ti.
analyzed: imā kho bhikkhu dve samāna savāsaka bhūmiyo ti
translated: These are the two grounds for being of the same affiliation.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū bhattagge antaraghare bhaṇḍanajātā kalahajātā vivādāpannā aññamaññaṁ ananulomikaṁ kāyakammaṁ vacīkammaṁ upadaṁsenti, hatthaparāmāsaṁ karonti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū bhattagge antaraghare bhaṇḍana jātā kalaha jātā vivāda āpannā aññamaññam ananulomikam kāya kammam vacī kammam upadasenti hattha parāmāsam karonti
translated: At that time, in a certain inhabited area, the monks were arguing, quarreling, and disputing in the dining hall, and they were misbehaving and making physical contact with one another.

original: Manussā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: manussāḥ ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: People complained and criticized them,

original: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā bhattagge antaraghare bhaṇḍanajātā kalahajātā
analyzed: kathan hi nāma samaṇā sakya puttiyā bhattagge antaraghare bhaṇḍana jātā kalaha jātā
translated: “How can the Sakyan monastics behave like this in the dining hall of an inhabited area?

original: vivādāpannā aññamaññaṁ ananulomikaṁ kāyakammaṁ vacīkammaṁ upadaṁsessanti, hatthaparāmāsaṁ karissantī”ti.🔽Assosuṁ kho bhikkhū tesaṁ manussānaṁ ujjhāyantānaṁ khiyyantānaṁ vipācentānaṁ.
analyzed: vivāda āpannāḥ aññamaññam ananulomikam kāya kammam vacī kammam upadasessanti hattha parāmāsam karissanti iti  assosum kho bhikkhū tesam manussānam ujjhāyantānam khiyyantānam vipācentāna
translated: They’re misbehaving and making physical contact with one another.”🔽The monks heard the complaints of those people,

original: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: ye te bhikkhū appicchā te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

original: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhū bhattagge antaraghare bhaṇḍanajātā kalahajātā vivādāpannā aññamaññaṁ ananulomikaṁ kāyakammaṁ vacīkammaṁ upadaṁsessanti, hatthaparāmāsaṁ karissantī”ti.
analyzed: katham hi nāma bhikkhū bhattagge antaraghare bhaṇḍana jātā kalaha jātā vivāda āpannā aññamaññam ananulomikam kāya kammam vacī kammam upadasessanti hattha parāmāsam karissanti iti
translated: “How can monks act like this?”

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ …pe…
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesuṃ pe
translated: The monks told the Buddha. …

original: “saccaṁ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhattagge antaraghare bhaṇḍanajātā …pe… hatthaparāmāsaṁ karontī”ti?
analyzed: saccam kira bhikkhave bhikkhū bhattagge antaraghare bhaṇḍana jātā pe hattha parāmāsam karonti iti
translated: “Is it true, monks, that monks are acting like this?”

original: “Saccaṁ, bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: sat ca bhagavān ati
translated: “It’s true, Sir.”

original: Vigarahi buddho bhagavā …pe…
analyzed: vigarahi buddhaḥ bhagavān pe
translated: The Buddha rebuked them …

original: vigarahitvā dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—🔽“bhinne, bhikkhave, saṅghe adhammiyāyamāne asammodikāya vattamānāya ‘ettāvatā na aññamaññaṁ ananulomikaṁ kāyakammaṁ vacīkammaṁ upadaṁsessāma, hatthaparāmāsaṁ karissāmā’ti—
analyzed: vigarahitvā dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi  bhinne bhikkhave saṅghe adhammiyāyamāne a sammodikāya vattamānāya ettāvatā na aññamaññam ananulomikam kāya kammam vacī kammam upadasessāma hattha parāmāsam karissāma ati
translated: and after rebuking them … he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

original: āsane nisīditabbaṁ.
analyzed: āsane
translated: “When the Sangha is divided and acting contrary to the Teaching, and it’s not being restored, you should sit down on your mat, thinking, ‘I won’t do anything improper by way of body or speech, or by way of grabbing, until this legal issue is resolved.’

original: Bhinne, bhikkhave, saṅghe dhammiyāyamāne sammodikāya vattamānāya āsanantarikāya nisīditabban”ti.
analyzed: bhinne bhikkhave saṅghe dhammiyāyamāne sammodikāya vattamānāya āsana ntarikāya nisīditabbanti
translated: When the Sangha is divided and is trying to resolve a legal issue, you should sit in the space between the two sides.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū saṅghamajjhe bhaṇḍanajātā kalahajātā vivādāpannā aññamaññaṁ mukhasattīhi vitudantā viharanti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū saṅgha majjhe bhaṇḍana jātā kalaha jātā vivāda āpannāḥ aññam aññam mukha sattīhi vitudantāḥ viharanti
translated: On one occasion the monks were arguing, quarreling, and disputing in the midst of the Sangha, wounding each other with verbal darts.

original: Te na sakkonti taṁ adhikaraṇaṁ vūpasametuṁ.
analyzed: te na sakkonti tam adhikaraṇam vūpasametu
translated: They were unable to resolve that legal issue.

original: Atha kho aññataro bhikkhu yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho aññataraḥ bhikkhu yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhāsi ekamantam ṭhitaḥ kho saḥ bhikkhu bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: A certain monk went to the Buddha, bowed, and told him what was happening.

original: “idha, bhante, bhikkhū saṅghamajjhe bhaṇḍanajātā kalahajātā vivādāpannā aññamaññaṁ mukhasattīhi vitudantā viharanti.
analyzed: idha bhante bhikkhū saṅgha majjhe bhaṇḍana jātā kalaha jātā vivāda āpannāḥ aññam aññam mukha sattīhi vitudantāḥ viharanti
translated: “Venerable Sir, the monks are arguing, quarreling, and disputing in the midst of the Sangha, wounding each other with verbal darts.

original: Te na sakkonti taṁ adhikaraṇaṁ vūpasametuṁ.
analyzed: te na sakkonti tam adhikaraṇam vūpasametu
translated: They are unable to resolve that legal issue.

original: Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā yena te bhikkhū tenupasaṅkamatu anukampaṁ upādāyā”ti.
analyzed: sādhu bhante bhagavā yena te bhikkhū tena upasaṅkamatu anukampam upādāya ati
translated: Sir, please go to them out of compassion.”

original: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.
analyzed: adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena
translated: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

original: Atha kho bhagavā yena te bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi, nisajja kho bhagavā te bhikkhū etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā yena te bhikkhū tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi nisajja kho bhagavā te bhikkhū etat avoca
translated: He then went to those monks and sat down on the prepared seat. He said to them,

original: “alaṁ, bhikkhave, mā bhaṇḍanaṁ mā kalahaṁ mā viggahaṁ mā vivādan”ti.
analyzed: ala bhikkhave mā bhaṇḍanam mā kalaham mā viggaham mā vivādanti
translated: “Enough, monks, don’t quarrel, dispute, and argue.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, aññataro adhammavādī bhikkhu bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: evam vutte aññataraḥ adhamma vādī bhikkhu bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: A certain unrighteous monk then said to the Buddha,

original: “āgametu, bhante, bhagavā dhammassāmī;
analyzed: āgametu bhante bhagavā dhamma ssāmī
translated: “Wait, Sir, the Buddha is the Lord of the Teaching.

original: appossukko, bhante, bhagavā diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāramanuyutto viharatu.
analyzed: appa ussukkaḥ bhante bhagavā diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāram anuyuttaḥ viharatu
translated: May he live at ease, devoted to a pleasant abiding in the here and now.

original: Mayametena bhaṇḍanena kalahena viggahena vivādena paññāyissāmā”ti.
analyzed: mayam etena bhaṇḍanena kalahena viggahena vivādena paññāyissāma ati
translated: We’ll sort out this quarrel, dispute, and argument.”

original: Dutiyampi kho bhagavā te bhikkhū etadavoca—
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho bhagavā te bhikkhū etat avoca
translated: A second time the Buddha said to those monks,

original: “alaṁ, bhikkhave, mā bhaṇḍanaṁ mā kalahaṁ mā viggahaṁ mā vivādan”ti.
analyzed: ala bhikkhave mā bhaṇḍanam mā kalaham mā viggaham mā vivādanti
translated: “Enough, monks, don’t quarrel, dispute, and argue.”

original: Dutiyampi kho so adhammavādī bhikkhu bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho saḥ adhamma vādī bhikkhu bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: A second time that unrighteous monk said to the Buddha,

original: “āgametu, bhante, bhagavā dhammassāmī;
analyzed: āgametu bhante bhagavā dhamma ssāmī
translated: “Wait, Sir, the Buddha is the Lord of the Teaching.

original: appossukko, bhante, bhagavā diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāramanuyutto viharatu.
analyzed: appa ussukkaḥ bhante bhagavā diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāram anuyuttaḥ viharatu
translated: ‘Venerable Sir, please don’t worry about that.

original: Mayametena bhaṇḍanena kalahena viggahena vivādena paññāyissāmā”ti.
analyzed: mayam etena bhaṇḍanena kalahena viggahena vivādena paññāyissāma ati
translated: We’ll sort it out.’

original: 2. Dīghāvuvatthu
analyzed: dīghaḥ u vatthu
translated: The account of Dīghāvu

original: Atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: The Buddha said to the monks,

original: “bhūtapubbaṁ, bhikkhave, bārāṇasiyaṁ brahmadatto nāma kāsirājā ahosi aḍḍho mahaddhano mahābhogo mahabbalo mahāvāhano mahāvijito paripuṇṇakosakoṭṭhāgāro.
analyzed: bhūta pubba bhikkhave bārāṇasiyam brahmadattaḥ nāma kāsi rājā ahosi aḍḍhaḥ mahat dhanaḥ mahā bhogaḥ mahat balaḥ mahā vāhanaḥ mahā vijitaḥ paripuṇṇa kosa koṭṭhāgāraḥ
translated: “Once, monks, in Benares, King Brahmadatta of Kāsī was rich, with great wealth and resources, powerful, with a great army, and victorious. His treasury and granary were full.

original: Dīghīti nāma kosalarājā ahosi daliddo appadhano appabhogo appabalo appavāhano appavijito aparipuṇṇakosakoṭṭhāgāro.🔽Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā caturaṅginiṁ senaṁ sannayhitvā dīghītiṁ kosalarājānaṁ abbhuyyāsi.
analyzed: dīghī iti nāma kosala rājā ahosi daliddaḥ appa dhanaḥ appabhogaḥ appa balaḥ appa vāhanaḥ appa vijitaḥ a paripuṇṇa kosa koṭṭhāgāro  atha kho bhikkhave brahmadattaḥ kāsi rājā caturaṅginim senam sannayhitvā dīghītim kosala rājānam abbhuyyāsi
translated: King Dīghīti of Kosala was poor, with little wealth and resources, weak, with a small army, and defeated. His treasury and granary were empty.🔽Then King Brahmadatta of Kāsī, after equipping his fourfold army, marched against King Dīghīti of Kosala.

original: Assosi kho, bhikkhave, dīghīti kosalarājā—‘brahmadatto kira kāsirājā caturaṅginiṁ senaṁ sannayhitvā mamaṁ abbhuyyāto’ti.
analyzed: assosi kho bhikkhave dīghī iti kosala rājā abrahmadattaḥ kira kāsi rājā caturaṅginim senam sannayhitvā abbhuyyāta iti
translated: King Dīghīti heard,

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghītissa kosalarañño etadahosi—‘brahmadatto kho kāsirājā aḍḍho
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave dīghītissa kosala rañño etat ahosi brahmadatto kho kāsi rājā aḍḍhaḥ
translated: Then King Dīghīti thought, ‘Brahmadatta is rich,

original: mahaddhano mahābhogo mahabbalo mahāvāhano mahāvijito paripuṇṇakosakoṭṭhāgāro, ahaṁ
analyzed: mahat dhanaḥ mahā bhogaḥ mahat balaḥ mahā vāhanaḥ mahā vijitaḥ paripuṇṇa kosa koṭṭhāgāraḥ aha
translated: wealthy, and prosperous, with great riches and great possessions, with great influence and great authority, with a full treasury and storehouse. But I am poor,

original: panamhi daliddo appadhano appabhogo appabalo appavāhano appavijito aparipuṇṇakosakoṭṭhāgāro,
analyzed: panamhi daliddaḥ appa dhanaḥ appabhogaḥ appa balaḥ appa vāhanaḥ appa vijitaḥ a paripuṇṇa kosa koṭṭhāgāro
translated: impoverished, and destitute, with little influence and little authority, with few riches and few possessions, with an empty treasury and storehouse.

original: nāhaṁ paṭibalo brahmadattena kāsiraññā ekasaṅghātampi sahituṁ.
analyzed: na aham paṭibalaḥ brahmadattena kāsi raññā eka saṅghātam pi sahitu
translated: I am not able to withstand King Brahmadatta even in a single encounter.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ paṭikacceva nagaramhā nippateyyan’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham paṭikaccā iva nagaramhā nippateyyanti
translated: Let me escape from the city before he arrives.’

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghīti kosalarājā mahesiṁ ādāya paṭikacceva nagaramhā nippati.
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave dīghīti kosala rājā mahesim ādāya paṭikaccā iva nagaramhā nippati
translated: So King Dīghīti took his chief consort and escaped from the city before King Brahmadatta arrived.

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā dīghītissa kosalarañño balañca vāhanañca janapadañca kosañca koṭṭhāgārañca abhivijiya ajjhāvasati.
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave brahmadattaḥ kāsi rājā dīghītissa kosala raññaḥ balañca vāhanañca janapadañca kosam ca koṭṭhāgārañca abhivijiya ajjhāvasati
translated: Then King Brahmadatta conquered Dīghīti’s forces, vehicles, and country, and he seized his treasury and storehouse.

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghīti kosalarājā sapajāpatiko yena bārāṇasī tena pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave dīghī iti kosala rājā sa pajāpatikaḥ yena bārāṇasī tena pakkāmi
translated: Then King Dīghīti, together with his chief consort, left for Bārāṇasī.

original: Anupubbena yena bārāṇasī tadavasari. Tatra sudaṁ, bhikkhave, dīghīti kosalarājā sapajāpatiko🔽bārāṇasiyaṁ aññatarasmiṁ paccantime okāse kumbhakāranivesane aññātakavesena paribbājakacchannena paṭivasati.
analyzed: anupubbena yena bārāṇasī tat avasari tatra suda bhikkhave dīghī iti kosala rājā sa pajāpatikaḥ  bārāṇasiyam aññatarasmim paccantime okāse kumbhakāra nivesane aññātaka vesena paribbājaka channena paṭivasati
translated: He eventually arrived at Benares, where he and his wife lived in disguise in a potter’s house on the outskirts of the city.

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghītissa kosalarañño mahesī nacirasseva gabbhinī ahosi.
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave dīghītissa kosala raññaḥ mahesī nacirassa iva gabbhinī ahosi
translated: Soon afterwards the queen became pregnant.

original: Tassā evarūpo dohaḷo uppanno hoti—icchati sūriyassa uggamanakāle caturaṅginiṁ senaṁ sannaddhaṁ vammikaṁ subhūme ṭhitaṁ passituṁ, khaggānañca dhovanaṁ pātuṁ.
analyzed: tassāḥ evarūpaḥ dohaḷaḥ uppanno hoti icchati sūriyassa uggamana kāle caturaṅginim senam sannaddham vammikam su bhūme ṭhitam passitu khaggānam ca dhovanam pātu
translated: And she developed a craving: she wanted to see an army of four divisions drawn up in battle formation on the plain at sunrise, and to drink the water used for washing the swords.

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghītissa kosalarañño mahesī dīghītiṁ kosalarājānaṁ etadavoca—‘gabbhinīmhi,🔽deva. Tassā me evarūpo dohaḷo uppanno—icchāmi sūriyassa uggamanakāle caturaṅginiṁ
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave dīghītissa kosala raññaḥ mahesī dīghītim kosala rājānam etat avoca gabbhinīmhi  deva tassā me evarūpaḥ dohaḷaḥ uppannaḥ icchāmi sūriyassa uggamana kāle caturaṅgini
translated: She told the king, who replied, ‘I’ll get it for you.’

original: senaṁ sannaddhaṁ vammikaṁ subhūme ṭhitaṁ passituṁ, khaggānañca dhovanaṁ pātun’ti.
analyzed: senam sannaddham vammikam su bhūme ṭhitam passitu khaggānam ca dhovanam pātunti
translated: But the king was unable to do so, and he died of grief.

original: ‘Kuto, devi, amhākaṁ duggatānaṁ caturaṅginī senā sannaddhā vammikā subhūme ṭhitā, khaggānañca dhovanaṁ pātun’ti
analyzed: kutas devi amhākam duggatānam caturaṅginī senā sannaddhā vammikā su bhūme ṭhitā khaggānam ca dhovanam pātunti
translated: ‘Your Majesty, where are we going to get an army of four divisions, ready for battle, standing on the anthill, and water for washing the swords?’

original: ‘sacāhaṁ, deva, na labhissāmi, marissāmī’ti.
analyzed: sacā āha deva na labhissāmi marissāmi iti
translated: ‘If I can’t have these things, I’ll die.’

original: Tena kho pana samayena, brahmadattassa kāsirañño purohito brāhmaṇo dīghītissa kosalarañño sahāyo hoti.🔽Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghīti kosalarājā yena brahmadattassa kāsirañño purohito brāhmaṇo
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena brahmadattassa kāsi raññaḥ purohitaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ dīghītissa kosala rañño sahāyaḥ hoti  atha kho bhikkhave dīghī iti kosala rājā yena brahmadattassa kāsi rañño purohitaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: At that time the brahmin who was the priest of King Brahmadatta was a friend of King Dīghīti.🔽So King Dīghīti went to the brahmin priest of King Brahmadatta

original: tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā brahmadattassa kāsirañño purohitaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ etadavoca—‘sakhī
analyzed: tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā brahmadattassa kāsirañño purohitam brāhmaṇam etat avoca sakhī
translated: and said, ‘My friend,

original: te, samma, gabbhinī.
analyzed: te samma gabbhinī
translated: your wife is pregnant.

original: Tassā evarūpo dohaḷo uppanno—icchati sūriyassa uggamanakāle caturaṅginiṁ senaṁ sannaddhaṁ vammikaṁ subhūme ṭhitaṁ passituṁ, khaggānañca dhovanaṁ pātun’ti.
analyzed: tassāḥ evarūpaḥ dohaḷaḥ uppannaḥ icchati sūriyassa uggamana kāle caturaṅginim senam sannaddham vammikam su bhūme ṭhitam passitu khaggānam ca dhovanam pātunti
translated: She has a craving: she wants to see an army of four divisions ready for battle standing on an anthill at sunrise, and she wants to drink the water used for washing the swords.’

original: ‘Tena hi, deva, mayampi deviṁ passāmā’ti.
analyzed: tena hi deva mayam pi devim passāma ati
translated: ‘Well then, Your Majesty, let’s see the queen.’

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghītissa kosalarañño mahesī yena brahmadattassa kāsirañño purohito brāhmaṇo tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave dīghītissa kosala raññaḥ mahesī yena brahmadattassa kāsi rañño purohitaḥ brāhmaṇo tena upasaṅkami
translated: The chief queen of the Kosalan king Dīghīti went to the brahmin chaplain of King Brahmadatta.

original: Addasā kho, bhikkhave, brahmadattassa kāsirañño purohito brāhmaṇo dīghītissa kosalarañño🔽mahesiṁ dūratova āgacchantiṁ, disvāna uṭṭhāyāsanā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā yena
analyzed: addasā kho bhikkhave brahmadattassa kāsi rañño purohitaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ dīghītissa kosala rañño  mahesim dūratas uva āgacchanti disvāna uṭṭhāya āsanā ekasam uttarāsaṅgam karitvā yena
translated: The brahmin chaplain of King Brahmadatta saw the chief queen of the Kosalan king Dīghīti coming in the distance,🔽and he rose from his seat, one shoulder of his upper robe bared,

original: dīghītissa kosalarañño mahesī tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā tikkhattuṁ udānaṁ udānesi—
analyzed: dīghītissa kosala raññaḥ mahesī tena añjalim paṇāmetvā tikkhattum udānam udānesi
translated: and paid homage to her with his joined palms. He uttered this inspired utterance three times:

original: ‘kosalarājā vata bho kucchigato, kosalarājā vata bho kucchigatoti.
analyzed: kosala rājā vata bho kucchigataḥ kosala rājā vata bho kucchigataḥ iti
translated: ‘The king of Kosala is in her womb! The king of Kosala is in her womb!’

original: Attamanā, devi, hohi.
analyzed: attamanāḥ devi hohi

translated: Then, after rising at the crack of dawn, Prince Dīghāvu sang and played his lute in the elephant stables.

analyzed: assosi kho bhikkhave brahmadatto kāsi rājā rattiyā paccūsa samayam paccuṭṭhāya hatthi sālāyam mañjunā sarena gītam vīṇam ca vādita sutvāna manusse pucchi
translated: King Brahmadatta heard the singing and playing, and he asked his men,

original: ‘ko, bhaṇe, rattiyā paccūsasamayaṁ paccuṭṭhāya hatthisālāyaṁ mañjunā sarena gāyi, vīṇañca vādesī’ti?
analyzed: kaḥ bhaṇe rattiyā paccūsa samayam paccuṭṭhāya hatthi sālāyam mañjunā sarena gāyi vīṇam ca vādesi iti
translated: ‘Who was that singing and playing in the elephant stables?’

original: ‘Amukassa, deva, hatthācariyassa antevāsī māṇavako rattiyā paccūsasamayaṁ paccuṭṭhāya hatthisālāyaṁ mañjunā sarena gāyi, vīṇañca vādesī’ti.
analyzed: amukassa deva hatthācariyassa antevāsī māṇavakaḥ rattiyā paccūsa samayam paccuṭṭhāya hatthi sālāyam mañjunā sarena gāyi vīṇam ca vādesi iti
translated: ‘Your Majesty, it was a young man who’s a student of such-and-such an elephant trainer.’

original: ‘Tena hi, bhaṇe, taṁ māṇavakaṁ ānethā’ti.
analyzed: tena hi bhaṇe tam māṇavakam ānetha iti
translated: ‘Well then, bring him here.’

original: ‘Evaṁ, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, te manussā brahmadattassa kāsirañño paṭissutvā dīghāvuṁ kumāraṁ ānesuṁ.
analyzed: eva deva iti kho bhikkhave te manussāḥ brahmadattassa kāsirañño paṭissutvā dīghāvum kumāram ānesu
translated: ‘Yes, sire,’ they replied, and they brought Prince Dīghāvu to him.

original: ‘Tvaṁ, bhaṇe māṇavaka, rattiyā paccūsasamayaṁ paccuṭṭhāya hatthisālāyaṁ mañjunā sarena gāyi, vīṇañca vādesī’ti?
analyzed: tva bhaṇe māṇavaka rattiyā paccūsa samayam paccuṭṭhāya hatthi sālāyam mañjunā sarena gāyi vīṇam ca vādesi iti
translated: ‘Hey, young man, did you get up at the crack of dawn and sing and play your lute in the elephant stables?’

original: ‘Evaṁ, devā’ti.
analyzed: eva deva ati
translated: ‘Yes, sire.’

original: ‘Tena hi tvaṁ, bhaṇe māṇavaka, gāyassu, vīṇañca vādehī’ti.
analyzed: tena hi tva bhaṇe māṇavaka gāyassu vīṇam ca vādehi iti
translated: ‘Well then, young man, sing and play your lute.’

original: ‘Evaṁ, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvu kumāro brahmadattassa kāsirañño paṭissutvā ārādhāpekkho mañjunā sarena gāyi, vīṇañca vādesi.
analyzed: eva deva ati kho bhikkhave dīghāvu kumāraḥ brahmadattassa kāsirañño paṭissutvā ārādha apekkhaḥ mañjunā sarena gāyi vīṇañca vādesi
translated: ‘Yes, sire,’ replied Dīghāvu. And in the hope of pleasing the king, he sang and played his lute.

original: ‘Tvaṁ, bhaṇe māṇavaka, maṁ upaṭṭhahā’ti.
analyzed: tva bhaṇe māṇavaka mam upaṭṭhahāti
translated: ‘Hey, young man, serve me.’

original: ‘Evaṁ, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvu kumāro brahmadattassa kāsirañño paccassosi.
analyzed: eva deva iti kho bhikkhave dīghāvu kumāraḥ brahmadattassa kāsirañño paccassosi
translated: ‘Yes, sire,’ replied Dīghāvu.

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvu kumāro brahmadattassa kāsirañño pubbuṭṭhāyī ahosi pacchānipātī kiṅkārapaṭissāvī manāpacārī piyavādī.
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave dīghāvu kumāraḥ brahmadattassa kāsi rañño pubbuṭṭhāyī ahosi pacchānipātī kiṅkāra paṭissāvī manāpa cārī piya vādī
translated: And he became the king’s attendant, getting up before him and going to bed after him, acting with kindness and sympathy, speaking politely to him.

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā dīghāvuṁ kumāraṁ nacirasseva abbhantarime vissāsikaṭṭhāne ṭhapesi.
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave brahmadattaḥ kāsi rājā dīghāvum kumāram nacirassa iva abbhantarime vissāsika ṭṭhāne ṭhapesi
translated: Soon King Brahmadatta trusted Prince Dīghāvu enough to leave him alone with his harem.

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā dīghāvuṁ kumāraṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave brahmadattaḥ kāsi rājā dīghāvum kumāram etat avoca
translated: Soon after this, King Brahmadatta trusted Prince Dīghāvu as much as he trusted himself.

original: ‘tena hi, bhaṇe māṇavaka, rathaṁ yojehi, migavaṁ gamissāmā’ti.
analyzed: tena hi bhaṇe māṇavaka ratham yojehi migavam gamissāma ati
translated: He said to him, ‘Well then, young man, please prepare my chariot. I’ll go hunting.’

original: ‘Evaṁ, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvu kumāro brahmadattassa kāsirañño paṭissutvā rathaṁ yojetvā brahmadattaṁ kāsirājānaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: eva deva iti khalu bhikkhave dīghāvu kumāraḥ brahmadattassa kāsi raññaḥ paṭissutvā ratham yojetvā brahmadattam kāsi rājānam etat avoca
translated: ‘Yes, sir,’ replied Dīghāvu, and he prepared the chariot. He then said to the king,

original: ‘yutto kho te, deva, ratho, yassadāni kālaṁ maññasī’ti.
analyzed: yuttaḥ kho te deva rathaḥ yaḥ sadāni kālam maññasi iti
translated: ‘Sir, the chariot is ready. Please go at your convenience.’

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā rathaṁ abhiruhi.
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave brahmadattaḥ kāsi rājā ratham abhiruhi
translated: The king then mounted the chariot.

original: Dīghāvu kumāro rathaṁ pesesi.
analyzed: dīghāvu kumāraḥ ratham pesesi
translated: Dīghāvu drove the chariot away.

original: Tathā tathā rathaṁ pesesi yathā yathā aññeneva senā agamāsi aññeneva ratho.
analyzed: tathā tathā ratham pesesi yathā yathā aññena iva senāḥ agamāsi aññena iva rathaḥ
translated: He drove it in such a way that the army went one way and the chariot another.

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā dūraṁ gantvā dīghāvuṁ kumāraṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu bhikkhave brahmadattaḥ kāsi rājā dūram gantvā dīghāvum kumāram etat avoca
translated: After going a long distance, the king said to Dīghāvu,

original: ‘tena hi, bhaṇe māṇavaka, rathaṁ muñcassu, kilantomhi, nipajjissāmī’ti.🔽‘Evaṁ, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvu kumāro brahmadattassa kāsirañño paṭissutvā rathaṁ muñcitvā pathaviyaṁ pallaṅkena nisīdi.
analyzed: tena hi bhaṇe māṇavaka ratham muñcassu kilantaḥ mhi nipajjissāmi iti  eva deva iti kho bhikkhave dīghāvu kumāraḥ brahmadattassa kāsirañño paṭissutvā ratham muñcitvā pathaviyam pallaṅkena nisīdi
translated: ‘Well then, young man, unhitch the chariot. I’m tired and will lie down.’🔽‘Yes, sir,’ replied Dīghāvu, and he did as asked.

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā dīghāvussa kumārassa ucchaṅge sīsaṁ katvā seyyaṁ kappesi.
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave brahmadattaḥ kāsi rājā dīghāvussa kumārassa ucchaṅge sīsam katvā seyyam kappesi
translated: The king laid his head on Dīghāvu’s lap and fell asleep.

original: Tassa kilantassa muhuttakeneva niddā okkami.
analyzed: tassa kilantassa muhuttakena iva niddā okkami
translated: And he was soon fast asleep.

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvussa kumārassa etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave dīghāvussa kumārassa etat ahosi
translated: Dīghāvu thought,

original: ‘ayaṁ kho brahmadatto kāsirājā bahuno amhākaṁ anatthassa kārako.
analyzed: ayam kho brahmadattaḥ kāsi rājā bahunaḥ amhākam anatthassa kārakaḥ
translated: ‘This King Brahmadatta has done us much harm.

original: Iminā amhākaṁ balañca vāhanañca janapado ca koso ca koṭṭhāgārañca acchinnaṁ.
analyzed: iminā amhākam balañca vāhanañca janapadaḥ ca kosaḥ ca koṭṭhāgārañca acchinna
translated: He has taken away our army, vehicles, lands, treasuries, and storehouses.

original: Iminā ca me mātāpitaro hatā.
analyzed: iminā ca me mātā pitaraḥ hatā
translated: And he has killed my parents.

original: Ayaṁ khvassa kālo yohaṁ veraṁ appeyyan’ti kosiyā khaggaṁ nibbāhi.
analyzed: ayam khvassa kālaḥ yaḥ uham veram appeyyanti kosiyā khaggam nibbāhi
translated: Now is the time to take revenge.’ He drew his sword from its scabbard.

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvussa kumārassa etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave dīghāvussa kumārassa etat ahosi
translated: But then he thought,

original: ‘pitā kho maṁ maraṇakāle avaca “mā kho tvaṁ, tāta dīghāvu, dīghaṁ passa, mā rassaṁ.
analyzed: pitā kho mama maraṇa kāle avaca mā kho tva tāta dīghāvu dīgham passa mā rassa
translated: ‘When he was dying, my father said to me, “Dear Dīghāvu, don’t think long-term, and don’t think short-term.

original: Na hi, tāta dīghāvu, verena verā sammanti;
analyzed: na hi tāta dīghāvu verena verā
translated: For vengeance is not settled through vengeance.

original: averena hi, tāta dīghāvu, verā sammantī”ti.
analyzed: averena hi tāta dīghāvu verā sammanti iti
translated: Only through non-vengeance is vengeance settled.”

original: Na kho metaṁ patirūpaṁ, yvāhaṁ pituvacanaṁ atikkameyyan’ti kosiyā khaggaṁ pavesesi.
analyzed: na kho mā etam pati rūpa yvā aham pitu vacanam atikkameyyanti kosiyā khaggam pavesesi
translated: It wouldn’t be right for me to disobey my father’s words.’ And he sheathed his sword in its scabbard.

original: Dutiyampi kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvussa kumārassa etadahosi—
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho bhikkhave dīghāvussa kumārassa etat ahosi
translated: For a second time, the thought occurred to Prince Dīghāvu,

original: ‘ayaṁ kho brahmadatto kāsirājā bahuno amhākaṁ anatthassa kārako, iminā amhākaṁ balañca
analyzed: ayam kho brahmadattaḥ kāsi rājā bahunaḥ amhākam anatthassa kārakaḥ iminā amhākam balañca
translated: ‘This King Brahmadatta of Kāsī has done us great harm. He has destroyed our army,

original: vāhanañca janapado ca koso ca koṭṭhāgārañca acchinnaṁ, iminā ca me mātāpitaro hatā,
analyzed: vāhanam ca janapadaḥ ca kosaḥ ca koṭṭhāgāram ca acchinnaḥ iminā ca me mātā pitaraḥ hatā
translated: our vehicles, our country, our wealth, and our granaries. He has killed my parents.

original: ayaṁ khvassa kālo yohaṁ veraṁ appeyyan’ti kosiyā khaggaṁ nibbāhi.
analyzed: ayam khvassa kālaḥ yaḥ uham veram appeyyanti kosiyā khaggam nibbāhi
translated: This is the time for me to repay the vengeance.’ And he drew his sword from its scabbard.

analyzed: dutiyam pi kho bhikkhave dīghāvussa kumārassa etat ahosi
translated: For a second time, the thought occurred to Prince Dīghāvu,

analyzed: pitā kho mama maraṇa kāle avaca mā kho tva tāta dīghāvu dīgham passa mā rassa na hi tāta dīghāvu verena verāḥ sammanti
translated: ‘At the time of his death, my father said to me, “Dear Dīghāvu, don’t think long-term, and don’t think short-term. For vengeance is not settled through vengeance.

original: averena hi, tāta dīghāvu, verā sammantī”ti.
analyzed: averena hi tāta dīghāvu verā sammanti iti
translated: Only through non-vengeance is vengeance settled.”

original: Na kho metaṁ patirūpaṁ, yvāhaṁ pituvacanaṁ atikkameyyan’ti.
analyzed: na khalu mā etam pati rūpa yvā aham pitu vacanam atikkameyyanti
translated: It wouldn’t be right for me to disobey my father’s words.’

original: Punadeva kosiyā khaggaṁ pavesesi.
analyzed: punar eva kosiyā khaggam pavesesi
translated: And he put the sword back in its scabbard.

original: Tatiyampi kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvussa kumārassa etadahosi—
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho bhikkhave dīghāvussa kumārassa etat ahosi
translated: For a third time, the thought occurred to Prince Dīghāvu,

analyzed: iminā amhākam balañca vāhanañca janapadaḥ ca kosaḥ ca koṭṭhāgārañca acchinna
translated: He has seized our troops, vehicles, lands, armories, and granaries.

analyzed: iminā ca me mātā pitaraḥ hatā
translated: And he has killed my parents.

analyzed: ayam khvassa kālaḥ yaḥ uham veram appeyyanti kosiyā khaggam nibbāhi
translated: This is the time for me to settle the score.’ And he drew his sword from its scabbard.

original: Tatiyampi kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvussa kumārassa etadahosi—
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho bhikkhave dīghāvussa kumārassa etat ahosi
translated: For a third time, the thought occurred to Prince Dīghāvu,

original: ‘pitā kho maṁ maraṇakāle avaca “mā kho tvaṁ, tāta dīghāvu, dīghaṁ passa, mā rassaṁ.
analyzed: pitā kho mama maraṇa kāle avaca mā kho tva tāta dīghāvu dīgham passa mā rassa
translated: ‘When he was dying, my father said to me, “Dear Dīghāvu, don’t look too far ahead or too far back.

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā bhīto ubbiggo ussaṅkī utrasto sahasā vuṭṭhāsi.
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave brahmadattaḥ kāsi rājā bhītaḥ ubbiggaḥ ussaṅkī utrastaḥ sahasā vuṭṭhāsi
translated: Then King Brahmadatta, frightened, alarmed, and terrified, suddenly got up.

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvu kumāro brahmadattaṁ kāsirājānaṁ etadavoca—‘kissa tvaṁ, deva, bhīto ubbiggo ussaṅkī utrasto sahasā vuṭṭhāsī’ti?
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave dīghāvu kumāraḥ brahmadattam kāsi rājānam etat avoca kissa tva deva bhītaḥ ubbiggaḥ ussaṅkī utrastaḥ sahasā vuṭṭhāsi iti
translated: Dīghāvu said to him, ‘Why did you get up so suddenly, so frightened, alarmed, and terrified?’

original: ‘Idha maṁ, bhaṇe māṇavaka, dīghītissa kosalarañño putto dīghāvu kumāro supinantena khaggena paripātesi.
analyzed: idha ma bhaṇe māṇavaka dīghītissa kosala rañño putto dīghāvu kumāraḥ supinantena khaggena paripātesi
translated: ‘Sir, the prince Dīghāvu, the son of King Dīghīti of Kosala, has just now threatened me in a dream with a sword.

original: Tenāhaṁ bhīto ubbiggo ussaṅkī utrasto sahasā vuṭṭhāsin’ti.
analyzed: tena aham bhītaḥ ubbiggaḥ ussaṅkī utrastaḥ sahasā vuṭṭhāsinti
translated: That’s why I got up so suddenly, so frightened, alarmed, and terrified.’

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvu kumāro vāmena hatthena brahmadattassa kāsirañño sīsaṁ parāmasitvā dakkhiṇena hatthena khaggaṁ nibbāhetvā brahmadattaṁ kāsirājānaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave dīghāvu kumāraḥ vāmena hatthena brahmadattassa kāsi raññaḥ sīsam parāmasitvā dakkhiṇena hatthena khaggam nibbāhetvā brahmadattam kāsi rājānam etat avoca
translated: Then Prince Dīghāvu, with his left hand holding King Brahmadatta’s head, and with his right hand drawing his sword, said to him,

original: ‘ahaṁ kho so, deva, dīghītissa kosalarañño putto dīghāvu kumāro.
analyzed: aham kho so deva dīghītissa kosala rañño putto dīghāvu kumāro
translated: ‘Your Majesty, I’m Prince Dīghāvu, the son of King Dīghīti of Kosala.

original: Bahuno tvaṁ amhākaṁ anatthassa kārako.
analyzed: bahunaḥ tvam amhākam anatthassa kārakaḥ
translated: You’ve done us a lot of harm.

original: Tayā amhākaṁ balañca vāhanañca janapado ca koso ca koṭṭhāgārañca acchinnaṁ.
analyzed: tayā amhākam balañca vāhanañca janapadaḥ ca kosaḥ ca koṭṭhāgārañca acchinna
translated: You’ve taken away our army, vehicles, lands, armories, and granaries.

original: Tayā ca me mātāpitaro hatā.
analyzed: tayā ca me mātā pitaraḥ hatā
translated: And you’ve killed my parents.

original: Ayaṁ khvassa kālo yvāhaṁ veraṁ appeyyan’ti.
analyzed: ayam khvassa kālaḥ yvā aham veram appeyyanti
translated: But now is the time for me to repay the harm.’

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā dīghāvussa kumārassa pādesu sirasā nipatitvā dīghāvuṁ kumāraṁ etadavoca—

translated: Then King Brahmadatta of Kāsī fell with his head at Prince Dīghāvu’s feet and said to him,

original: ‘jīvitaṁ me, tāta dīghāvu, dehi. Jīvitaṁ me, tāta dīghāvu, dehī’ti.
analyzed: jīvitam me tāta dīghāvu dehi jīvitam me tāta dīghāvu dehi iti
translated: ‘Give me my life, dear Dīghāvu. Give me my life, dear Dīghāvu.’

original: ‘Kyāhaṁ ussahāmi devassa jīvitaṁ dātuṁ?
analyzed: kyā aham ussahāmi devassa jīvitam dātu
translated: ‘How could I give your life back to you?

original: Devo kho me jīvitaṁ dadeyyā’ti.
analyzed: devaḥ khalu me jīvitam dadeyyāti
translated: But you should give me my life back.’

original: ‘Tena hi, tāta dīghāvu, tvañceva me jīvitaṁ dehi, ahañca te jīvitaṁ dammī’ti.
analyzed: tena hi tāta dīghāvu tvañca iva me jīvitam dehi aham ca te jīvitam dammi iti
translated: ‘Well then, dear Dīghāvu, you give me your life and I’ll give you mine.’

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto ca kāsirājā dīghāvu ca kumāro aññamaññassa jīvitaṁ adaṁsu, pāṇiñca aggahesuṁ, sapathañca akaṁsu addūbhāya.
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave brahmadatto ca kāsi rājā dīghāvu ca kumāraḥ aññamaññassa jīvitam pāṇiñca aggahesu sapatham ca akasu addūbhāya
translated: And so King Brahmadatta and Prince Dīghāvu gave their lives to each other, took each other’s hands, and swore a solemn vow.

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā dīghāvuṁ kumāraṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave brahmadattaḥ kāsi rājā dīghāvum kumāram etat avoca
translated: Then King Brahmadatta said to Prince Dīghāvu,

original: ‘tena hi, tāta dīghāvu, rathaṁ yojehi, gamissāmā’ti.
analyzed: tena hi tāta dīghāvu ratham yojehi gamissāma ati
translated: ‘Well then, dear Dīghāvu, harness the chariot. Let’s go.’

original: ‘Evaṁ, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvu kumāro brahmadattassa kāsirañño paṭissutvā rathaṁ yojetvā brahmadattaṁ kāsirājānaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: eva deva iti khalu bhikkhave dīghāvu kumāraḥ brahmadattassa kāsi raññaḥ paṭissutvā ratham yojetvā brahmadattam kāsi rājānam etat avoca
translated: ‘Yes, sir,’ Dīghāvu replied. He harnessed the chariot and said to the king,

original: ‘yutto kho te, deva, ratho, yassadāni kālaṁ maññasī’ti.
analyzed: yuttaḥ kho te deva rathaḥ yaḥ sadāni kālam maññasi iti

translated: At that time Venerable Anuruddha, Venerable Nandiya, and Venerable Kimbila were staying at the Eastern Bamboo Park.

original: “mā, samaṇa, etaṁ dāyaṁ pāvisi.
analyzed: mā samaṇaḥ etam dāyam pāvisi
translated: The park keeper saw the Buddha coming and said to him, “Don’t enter this park, ascetic.

original: Santettha tayo kulaputtā attakāmarūpā viharanti.
analyzed: santā ittha tayo kula puttāḥ atta kāmarūpāḥ viharanti
translated: There are three young men who are staying here as they like.

original: Mā tesaṁ aphāsumakāsī”ti.
analyzed: mā tesam a phāsum akāsi iti
translated: Don’t make it uncomfortable for them.”

original: Assosi kho āyasmā anuruddho dāyapālassa bhagavatā saddhiṁ mantayamānassa, sutvāna dāyapālaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: assosi kho āyasman anuruddhaḥ dāyapālassa bhagavatā saddhim mantayamānassa sutvāna dāyapālam etat avoca
translated: Anuruddha heard the park keeper talking with the Buddha, and he said to the park keeper,

original: “māvuso dāyapāla, bhagavantaṁ vāresi.
analyzed: mā avusaḥ dāyapāla bhagavantam vāresi
translated: “Don’t stop the Buddha.

original: Satthā no bhagavā anuppatto”ti.
analyzed: satthā naḥ bhagavā anuppatto ti
translated: The Buddha, our Teacher, has arrived.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā anuruddho yenāyasmā ca nandiyo āyasmā ca kimilo tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantañca nandiyaṁ āyasmantañca kimilaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmai anuruddhaḥ yena āyasmā ca nandiyaḥ āyasmā ca kimilaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam ca nandiyam āyasmantam ca kimilam etat avoca
translated: Anuruddha went to Nandiya and Kimbila and said,

original: “abhikkamathāyasmanto abhikkamathāyasmanto, satthā no bhagavā anuppatto”ti.🔽Atha kho āyasmā ca anuruddho āyasmā ca nandiyo āyasmā ca kimilo bhagavantaṁ paccuggantvā🔽eko bhagavato pattacīvaraṁ paṭiggahesi, eko āsanaṁ paññapesi, eko pādodakaṁ pādapīṭhaṁ
analyzed: abhikkamatha ayasmantaḥ abhikkamatha ayasmantaḥ satthā naḥ bhagavā anuppatto ti  atha kho āyasmā ca anuruddhaḥ āyasmā ca nandiyaḥ āyasmā ca kimilaḥ bhagavantam paccuggantvā  ekaḥ bhagavataḥ patta cīvaram paṭiggahesi ekaḥ āsanam paññapesi ekaḥ pāda udakam pāda pīṭha
translated: “Come out, Venerables, come out! The Buddha has arrived.”🔽They went out to meet the Buddha

original: pādakathalikaṁ upanikkhipi.
analyzed: pāda kathalikam upanikkhipi
translated: one taking his bowl and robe, one preparing a seat, and one setting out water for washing his feet, a foot stool, and a foot scraper.

original: Nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane, nisajja kho bhagavā pāde pakkhālesi.🔽Tepi kho āyasmanto bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
analyzed: nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane nisajja kho bhagavā pāde pakkhālesi  te api khalu āyasmantaḥ bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam
translated: The Buddha sat down on the prepared seat and washed his feet.🔽The monks bowed to the Buddha and sat down,

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho āyasmantaṁ anuruddhaṁ bhagavā etadavoca—
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnam khalu āyasmantam anuruddham bhagavān etat avoca
translated: and the Buddha said to Anuruddha,

original: “kacci vo, anuruddhā, khamanīyaṁ, kacci yāpanīyaṁ;
analyzed: kacci vaḥ anuruddhā khamanīya kacci yāpanīya
translated: “I hope you’re all keeping well, Anuruddha, I hope you’re getting by. I hope you’re not having any trouble.

original: kacci piṇḍakena na kilamathā”ti?
analyzed: piṇḍakena na
translated: Are you not exhausted by alms round?”

original: “Khamanīyaṁ, bhagavā, yāpanīyaṁ, bhagavā;
analyzed: khamanīya bhagavā yāpanīya bhagavā
translated: “We are well, Blessed One, we are getting by,

original: na ca mayaṁ, bhante, piṇḍakena kilamāmā”ti.
analyzed: na ca bhante piṇḍakena
translated: and we are not exhausted by alms round.”

original: “Kacci pana vo, anuruddhā, samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā khīrodakībhūtā aññamaññaṁ piyacakkhūhi sampassantā viharathā”ti?
analyzed: kacci pana vaḥ anuruddhā samaggā sammodamānā a vivadamānā khīrodakībhūtā aññam aññam piya cakkhūhi sampassantā viharatha ati
translated: “But, Anuruddha, do you live in peace and harmony, without quarreling, blending like milk and water, looking at each other with eyes of affection?”

original: “Taggha mayaṁ, bhante, samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā khīrodakībhūtā aññamaññaṁ piyacakkhūhi sampassantā viharāmā”ti.
analyzed: tat ha maya bhante samaggā sammodamānā a vivadamānā khīrodakībhūtā aññam aññam piya cakkhūhi sampassantā viharāma ati
translated: “Yes, Venerable Sir.”

original: “Yathā kathaṁ pana tumhe, anuruddhā, samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā khīrodakībhūtā aññamaññaṁ piyacakkhūhi sampassantā viharathā”ti?
analyzed: yathā katham pana tumhe anuruddhā samaggā sammodamānā a vivadamānā khīrodakībhūtā aññam aññam piya cakkhūhi sampassantā viharatha ati
translated: “But how do you live in peace and harmony, without quarreling, blending like milk and water, looking at each other with eyes of affection?”

original: “Idha mayhaṁ, bhante, evaṁ hoti—
analyzed: idha bhante evam hoti
translated: “Venerable Sir, I think like this:

original: ‘lābhā vata me, suladdhaṁ vata me, yohaṁ evarūpehi sabrahmacārīhi saddhiṁ viharāmī’ti.
analyzed: lābhāḥ vata me su laddham vata me yaḥ ham evarūpehi sabrahmacārīhi saddhim viharāmi iti
translated: ‘It’s a great gain for me that I get to live with such fellow monastics!’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, bhante, imesu āyasmantesu mettaṁ kāyakammaṁ paccupaṭṭhitaṁ āvi ceva raho ca;🔽mettaṁ vacīkammaṁ …
analyzed: tassa bhante imesu āyasmantesu mettam kāya kammam paccupaṭṭhitam āvi ca iva raho ca  mettam vacī kammam
translated: I have loving physical actions towards these venerable ones, both in public and in private,🔽I have loving verbal actions towards them, both in public and in private,

original: mettaṁ manokammaṁ paccupaṭṭhitaṁ āvi ceva raho ca.
analyzed: mettam mano kammam paccupaṭṭhitam āvi ca iva raho ca
translated: I have loving mental actions towards them, both in public and in private.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, bhante, evaṁ hoti—
analyzed: tassa bhante evam hoti
translated: I think:

original: ‘yannūnāhaṁ sakaṁ cittaṁ nikkhipitvā imesaṁyeva āyasmantānaṁ cittassa vasena vatteyyan’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham sakam cittam nikkhipitvā āyasmantānam cittassa vasena vatteyyanti
translated: ‘Why don’t I give up my own ideas and follow the ideas of these venerable ones?’

original: So kho ahaṁ, bhante, sakaṁ cittaṁ nikkhipitvā imesaṁyeva āyasmantānaṁ cittassa vasena vattāmi.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha bhante sakam cittam nikkhipitvā āyasmantānam cittassa vasena vattāmi
translated: So I give up my own ideas and follow the ideas of these venerable ones.

original: Nānā hi kho no, bhante, kāyā, ekañca pana maññe cittan”ti.
analyzed: nānā hi kho no bhante kāyāḥ ekam ca pana maññe cittanti
translated: Our bodies are different, but our minds are one.”

original: Āyasmāpi kho nandiyo …pe…
analyzed: kho nandiyo pe
translated: The venerable Nandiya …

original: āyasmāpi kho kimilo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: āyasmā api kho kimilaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: The venerable Kimbila said to the Buddha:

original: “mayhampi kho, bhante, evaṁ hoti—
analyzed: mayham pi kho bhante evam hoti
translated: “I too think:

original: ‘lābhā vata me, suladdhaṁ vata me, yohaṁ evarūpehi sabrahmacārīhi saddhiṁ viharāmī’ti.
analyzed: lābhāḥ vata me su laddham vata me yaḥ ham evarūpehi sabrahmacārīhi saddhim viharāmi iti
translated: ‘It’s a gain for me, it’s a great gain for me, that I get to live with such companions in the spiritual life!’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, bhante, imesu āyasmantesu mettaṁ kāyakammaṁ paccupaṭṭhitaṁ āvi ceva raho ca;
analyzed: tassa bhante imesu āyasmantesu mettam kāya kammam paccupaṭṭhitam āvi ca iva raho ca
translated: I have loving physical behavior towards them in public and in private,

original: mettaṁ vacīkammaṁ mettaṁ manokammaṁ paccupaṭṭhitaṁ āvi ceva raho ca.
analyzed: mettam vacī kammam mettam manaḥ kammam paccupaṭṭhitam āvi ca iva raho ca
translated: and loving verbal behavior.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, bhante, evaṁ hoti—
analyzed: tassa bhante evam hoti
translated: I think:

original: ‘yannūnāhaṁ sakaṁ cittaṁ nikkhipitvā imesaṁyeva āyasmantānaṁ cittassa vasena vatteyyan’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham sakam cittam nikkhipitvā āyasmantānam cittassa vasena vatteyyanti
translated: ‘Why don’t I give up my own ideas and follow the ideas of these venerables?’

original: So kho ahaṁ, bhante, sakaṁ cittaṁ nikkhipitvā imesaṁyeva āyasmantānaṁ cittassa vasena vattāmi.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha bhante sakam cittam nikkhipitvā āyasmantānam cittassa vasena vattāmi
translated: So I give up my own ideas and follow the ideas of these venerables.

original: Nānā hi kho no, bhante, kāyā, ekañca pana maññe cittanti.
analyzed: nānā hi kho no bhante kāyāḥ ekam ca pana maññe cittanti
translated: Our bodies are different, but our minds are one.”

original: Evaṁ kho mayaṁ, bhante, samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā khīrodakībhūtā aññamaññaṁ piyacakkhūhi sampassantā viharāmā”ti.
analyzed: evam kho bhante samaggā sammodamānā a vivadamānā khīrodakībhūtāḥ aññam aññam piya cakkhūhi sampassantā viharāma ati
translated: This is how we live together in peace and harmony, without quarreling, blending like milk and water, looking at one another with eyes of affection.”

original: “Kacci pana vo, anuruddhā, appamattā ātāpino pahitattā viharathā”ti?
analyzed: kacci pana vaḥ anuruddhāḥ appamattāḥ ātāpinaḥ pahita ttāḥ viharatha ati
translated: “But, Anuruddha, do you live heedfully, ardent and resolute?”

original: “Taggha mayaṁ, bhante, appamattā ātāpino pahitattā viharāmā”ti.
analyzed: tat ha maya bhante appamattāḥ ātāpinaḥ pahitattāḥ viharāma ati
translated: “Yes, Sir.”

original: “Yathā kathaṁ pana tumhe, anuruddhā, appamattā ātāpino pahitattā viharathā”ti?
analyzed: yathā katham pana tumhe anuruddhāḥ appamattāḥ ātāpinaḥ pahitattāḥ viharatha ati
translated: “But, Anuruddha, how do you live diligently, ardent, and resolute?”

original: “Idha, bhante, amhākaṁ yo paṭhamaṁ gāmato piṇḍāya paṭikkamati so āsanaṁ paññapeti,🔽pādodakaṁ pādapīṭhaṁ pādakathalikaṁ upanikkhipati, avakkārapātiṁ dhovitvā upaṭṭhāpeti,
analyzed: idha bhante amhākam yaḥ paṭhamam gāmataḥ piṇḍāya paṭikkamati saḥ āsanam paññapeti  pāda udakam pāda pīṭham pāda kathalikam upanikkhipati avakkāra pātim dhovitvā upaṭṭhāpeti
translated: “Here, Lord, whoever returns first from going for alms in the village sets out the seats,

original: pānīyaṁ paribhojanīyaṁ upaṭṭhāpeti.🔽Yo pacchā gāmato piṇḍāya paṭikkamati, sace hoti bhuttāvaseso, sace ākaṅkhati bhuñjati, no ce ākaṅkhati appaharite vā chaḍḍeti.
analyzed: pānīyam paribhojanīyam upaṭṭhāpeti  yaḥ pacchā gāmataḥ piṇḍāya paṭikkamati sace hoti bhutta avasesaḥ sace ākaṅkhati bhuñjati no ce ākaṅkhati appaharite vā chaḍḍeti
translated: puts out washing water for the feet, a foot stand, and a pebble foot wiper. He cleans the eating hall and sets out drinking water and washing water.

original: Appāṇake vā udake opilāpeti.
analyzed: appāṇake vai udake
translated: Whoever returns last from going for alms in the village, if there is food left over, he puts it away. If not, he tidies up the eating hall, puts away the drinking water and washing water, and hangs up the water vessel.

original: So āsanaṁ uddharati, pādodakaṁ pādapīṭhaṁ pādakathalikaṁ paṭisāmeti, avakkārapātiṁ dhovitvā paṭisāmeti, pānīyaṁ paribhojanīyaṁ paṭisāmeti, bhattaggaṁ sammajjati.
analyzed: saḥ āsanam uddharati pāda udakam pāda pīṭham pāda kathalikam paṭisāmeti avakkāra pātim dhovitvā paṭisāmeti pānīyam paribhojanīyam paṭisāmeti bhattaggam sammajjati
translated: He puts away the seats, the washing water for the feet, the foot stool, and the foot wiper. He cleans the eating hall and puts away the refuse container.

original: Yo passati pānīyaghaṭaṁ vā paribhojanīyaghaṭaṁ vā vaccaghaṭaṁ vā rittaṁ tucchaṁ so upaṭṭhāpeti.
analyzed: yaḥ passati pānīya ghaṭam vā paribhojanīya ghaṭam vā vacca ghaṭam vā rittam tuccham saḥ upaṭṭhāpeti
translated: Whoever sees that the drinking water vessel, the washing water vessel, or the water vessel is empty takes care of it.

original: Sacassa hoti avisayhaṁ, hatthavikārena dutiyaṁ āmantetvā hatthavilaṅghakena upaṭṭhāpema, na tveva mayaṁ, bhante, tappaccayā vācaṁ bhindāma.
analyzed: sacassa hoti hattha vikārena dutiyam āmantetvā hattha vilaṅghakena upaṭṭhāpema na tu eva bhante tad paccayāḥ vācam bhindāma
translated: If it is not too much trouble for him, he calls a second time by a gesture of his hand. If it is still not too much trouble for him, he calls a third time by a gesture of his foot. But we do not speak a word on account of that.

original: Pañcāhikaṁ kho pana mayaṁ, bhante, sabbarattiṁ dhammiyā kathāya sannisīdāma.
analyzed: pañcāhikam kho pana bhante sabbarattim dhammiyā kathāya sannisīdāma
translated: And every five days we sit together all night discussing the Dhamma.

original: Evaṁ kho mayaṁ, bhante, appamattā ātāpino pahitattā viharāmā”ti.
analyzed: evam kho bhante appamattāḥ ātāpinaḥ pahita ttāḥ viharāma ati
translated: It is in this way, venerable sir, that we dwell diligent, ardent, and resolute.”

original: 5. Pālileyyakagamanakathā🔽Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantañca anuruddhaṁ āyasmantañca nandiyaṁ āyasmantañca kimilaṁ
analyzed: pālileyyaka gamana kathā  atha khalu bhagavān āyasmantam ca anuruddham āyasmantam ca nandiyam āyasmantam ca kimila
translated: The Discussion of Going to Pālileyyaka

original: dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā yena🔽pālileyyakaṁ tena cārikaṁ pakkāmi.
analyzed: dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahasetvā uṭṭhāya āsanā yena  pālileyyakam tena cārikam
translated: Then the Blessed One, having instructed, urged, roused, & encouraged Ven. Anuruddha, Ven. Nandiya, & Ven. Kimbila with a Dhamma talk, got up from his seat and set out on a wandering tour toward Pālileyyaka.

original: Anupubbena cārikaṁ caramāno yena pālileyyakaṁ tadavasari.
analyzed: anupubbena cārikam caramānaḥ yena pālileyyakam tat avasari
translated: Wandering by stages, he arrived at Pālileyyaka.

original: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā pālileyyake viharati rakkhitavanasaṇḍe bhaddasālamūle.
analyzed: tatra sudam bhagavā pālileyyake viharati rakkhitavana saṇḍe bhaddasāla mūle
translated: There he stayed in Pālileyyaka in a protected forest grove at the root of a certain tree.

original: Atha kho bhagavato rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavataḥ rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evam cetasaḥ parivitakkaḥ udapādi
translated: Then, while reflecting in private, this thought came to his mind:

original: “ahaṁ kho pubbe ākiṇṇo na phāsu vihāsiṁ tehi kosambakehi bhikkhūhi bhaṇḍanakārakehi kalahakārakehi vivādakārakehi bhassakārakehi saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakehi.
analyzed: aham kho pubbe ākiṇṇaḥ na phāsu vihāsim tehi kosambakehi bhikkhūhi bhaṇḍana kārakehi kalaha kārakehi vivāda kārakehi bhassa kārakehi saṅghe adhikaraṇa kārakehi
translated: “Before, when I was surrounded by those monks from Kosambī who were quarrelsome, makers of strife, makers of disputes, makers of rumors, makers of issues in the Saṅgha, I didn’t live comfortably.

original: Somhi etarahi eko adutiyo sukhaṁ phāsu viharāmi aññatreva tehi kosambakehi bhikkhūhi bhaṇḍanakārakehi kalahakārakehi vivādakārakehi bhassakārakehi saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakehī”ti.
analyzed: somhi etarahi ekaḥ adutiyaḥ sukham phāsu viharāmi aññatra iva tehi kosambakehi bhikkhūhi bhaṇḍana kārakehi kalaha kārakehi vivāda kārakehi bhassa kārakehi saṅghe adhikaraṇa kārakehi iti
translated: But now, when I’m alone with no companion, I live comfortably, free from those monks from Kosambī who are quarrelsome, makers of strife, makers of disputes, makers of rumors, makers of issues in the Saṅgha.”

original: Aññataropi kho hatthināgo ākiṇṇo viharati hatthīhi hatthinīhi hatthikaḷabhehi hatthicchāpehi,🔽chinnaggāni ceva tiṇāni khādati, obhaggobhaggañcassa sākhābhaṅgaṁ khādanti, āvilāni
analyzed: aññataraḥ api kho hatthi nāgaḥ ākiṇṇaḥ viharati hatthīhi hatthinīhi hatthi kaḷabhehi hatthi chāpehi  chinnaggāni ca iva tiṇāni khādati sākhābhaṅgam khādanti āvilāni
translated: A certain bull elephant, too, was living hemmed in by elephants, cow-elephants, calf-elephants, & baby elephants.

original: ca pānīyāni pivati, ogāhā cassa otiṇṇassa hatthiniyo kāyaṁ upanighaṁsantiyo gacchanti.
analyzed: ca pānīyāni pivati ogāhā cassa otiṇṇassa hatthiniyaḥ kāyam upanighasantiyaḥ gacchanti
translated: He ate the grass cut by them and they ate the broken branches cut by him. He drank the water disturbed by them and, after he had gone down into the water, cow-elephants went along rubbing against his body.

original: Atha kho tassa hatthināgassa etadahosi—🔽“ahaṁ kho ākiṇṇo viharāmi hatthīhi hatthinīhi hatthikaḷabhehi hatthicchāpehi, chinnaggāni🔽ceva tiṇāni khādāmi, obhaggobhaggañca me sākhābhaṅgaṁ khādanti, āvilāni ca pānīyāni
analyzed: atha kho tassa hatthi nāgassa etat ahosi  aham kho ākiṇṇaḥ viharāmi hatthīhi hatthinīhi hatthi kaḷabhehi hatthi chāpehi chinnaggāni  ca iva tiṇāni khādāmi obhagga ubhaggam ca me sākhābhaṅgam khādanti āvilāni ca pānīyāni
translated: Then the thought occurred to the elephant:

original: pivāmi, ogāhā ca me otiṇṇassa hatthiniyo kāyaṁ upanighaṁsantiyo gacchanti.
analyzed: pivāmi ogāhā ca me otiṇṇassa hatthiniyaḥ kāyam upanighasantiyaḥ gacchanti
translated: “I’m living crowded with elephants, cow-elephants, calf-elephants, & elephant cubs. I eat grass that’s been chewed. They eat the broken twigs & leaves. I drink disturbed water. When I enter the water, cow-elephants go along rubbing against my body.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ ekova gaṇasmā vūpakaṭṭho vihareyyan”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham ekaḥ iva gaṇasmai vūpakaṭṭhaḥ vihareyyanti
translated: “What if I were to live alone, withdrawn from the group?”

original: Atha kho so hatthināgo yūthā apakkamma yena pālileyyakaṁ rakkhitavanasaṇḍo bhaddasālamūlaṁ
analyzed: atha kho saḥ hatthi nāgaḥ yūthāḥ apakkamma yena pālileyyakam rakkhita vana saṇḍaḥ bhaddasāla mūla
translated: Then the elephant, leaving the herd, went to Pārileyyaka, the protected forest grove, to the root of the auspicious sal tree

original: yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā soṇḍāya bhagavato pānīyaṁ paribhojanīyaṁ
analyzed: yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā soṇḍāya bhagavataḥ pānīyam paribhojanīya
translated: and, on arrival, used his trunk to set out drinking water & washing water

original: upaṭṭhāpeti, appaharitañca karoti.
analyzed: upaṭṭhāpeti appaharitañca karoti
